but his hook makes up for a nice ride

title: MY ZOOOTCH (Every Thing On It)
first_line: I never have nightmares,
crowdsourced_poem:
Never as I sleep.
I do have dreams tho,
that cause me to peep.

title: MY ZOOOTCH (Every Thing On It)
first_line: I never have nightmares,
crowdsourced_poem:
Though some folks have nightmares every night.
Instead I have nightstallions
And that makes things all right.

title: MY ZOOOTCH (Every Thing On It)
first_line: I never have nightmares,
crowdsourced_poem:
Nightmares I have never had,
laughing and playing ,daydreaming all day
at night , too tired to chase scary things or run away.

title: NOPE (Falling Up)
first_line: I put a piece of cantaloupe
crowdsourced_poem:
Where you might ask?
It was no small feat
I shoved it into the microscope real neat!

title: NOPE (Falling Up)
first_line: I put a piece of cantaloupe
crowdsourced_poem:
I put a piece of cantaloupe
Underneath the microscope.
I saw a million strange things sleepin’,

title: NOPE (Falling Up)
first_line: I put a piece of cantaloupe
crowdsourced_poem:
I put a piece of cantaloupe
Inside the massive microscope
I said "nope", this is dope!

title: MY RULES (Where the Sidewalk Ends)
first_line: If you want to marry me, here’s what you’ll have to do:
crowdsourced_poem:
I have a few rules just for you
Now don't be afraid, it's really just one
Whenever I'm troubled, don't make it doubled

title: MY RULES (Where the Sidewalk Ends)
first_line: If you want to marry me, here’s what you’ll have to do:
crowdsourced_poem:
Put my troubled past behind you
Let me make the rules
Cause I don't marry no fools

title: MY RULES (Where the Sidewalk Ends)
first_line: If you want to marry me, here’s what you’ll have to do:
crowdsourced_poem:
No rulesif you love me too
If I troubled you, punish me too
Make a life funny, in presence of you

title: DIVING BOARD (Falling Up)
first_line: You’ve been up on that diving board
crowdsourced_poem:
Bouncing so very high.
You've now left on the diving board.
Your speedo before the dive.

title: DIVING BOARD (Falling Up)
first_line: You’ve been up on that diving board
crowdsourced_poem:
Little man, little man
it's time to come down
Stan, Stan, Stan

title: DIVING BOARD (Falling Up)
first_line: You’ve been up on that diving board
crowdsourced_poem:
Slowing looking down, you take a dive
You fall into a pool of jello
Just thankful to be alive.

title: HAPPY ENDING? (Every Thing On It)
first_line: There are no happy endings.
crowdsourced_poem:
We can only hope to have a happy start
and many happy journeys
those are more important than the endings.

title: HAPPY ENDING? (Every Thing On It)
first_line: There are no happy endings.
crowdsourced_poem:
so where should I start?
He walked into my life
and broke my heart.

title: HAPPY ENDING? (Every Thing On It)
first_line: There are no happy endings.
crowdsourced_poem:
is a way to look at it
remember to start smiling
or you'll feel like you're in a pit

title: YEARS FROM NOW (Every Thing On It)
first_line: Although I cannot see your face
crowdsourced_poem:
But I can feel that you staring
I know you are far away
But I miss you more than ever

title: YEARS FROM NOW (Every Thing On It)
first_line: Although I cannot see your face
crowdsourced_poem:
my memory transcends all space
I still hear your goofy laughing
a huge smile on your always happy face

title: YEARS FROM NOW (Every Thing On It)
first_line: Although I cannot see your face
crowdsourced_poem:
I still imagine your clown smile
I know your not laughing at all
But your looks makes me laugh
